GROWTH OF CO2 EMISSION
Ever since the beginning of industrial revolution. The CO2 emission has increased drastically. We can see how the levels of CO2 in the atmosphere has gone up since 1850.
CO2 AND TEMPERATURE TRACKER
The barchart on the right tracks the growth of CO2 and temperature with each passing year

TOP EMITTERS
If we examine the top CO2 emitters for 2017. We can see that China tops the list followed by United States and EU.
COLLECTIVE CONTRIBUTION
On closely examining the percentage contribution of China, US and EU, we came to know that their collective contribution to the CO2 emission is more than 50%. And this followed by emerging giants like India and Russia while others contribution is 36%.

SOLUTION
- The developed countries should start reducing their CO2 emissions and the rest of the world will follow

- Low carbon technology should be cheap and available, since this will reduce the developing countries' dependence on fossil fuels

- Climate change is a global problem and no country alone can fix it
